website_summaries.verdict: The best value for your money. Compact size affords easy portability while fitting snugly into small spaces.
pros: Praised for its innovative twisting action, which tones and strengthens muscles unlike any other unit on the market
cons: Some customers liken the machine's small stride to taking "baby steps" rather than full strides

customer_reviews.title: WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something effective. I wanted something easy on my body. I wanted something that took up little space. I wanted something that was portable. I wanted something that was easy to use. I wanted something that was inexpensive and of great quality. This machine met every one of my wants! I've lost 50 lbs too in 6 months. My legs and butt are firmer. I like to use this while watching TV. It's very quiet. Great machine and very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sherril ✌️💕🌞

customer_reviews.title: Hooked with this!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this thing! Use it EVERY DAY at the office when feel like bringing my HR up. You can surely feel the burn right away! It's sturdy and very stable, easy to stow as well. Worth every penny---hopefully will last for life.
customer_reviews.author: JessJulio

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 4 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product about four weeks ago, and it was working great for the first three weeks. I have bad knees, so this was a nice way to simulate running without the impact. I would have given this 4 stars, since it is a nice unit but a little loud. Unfortunately, a crack began to form in front of the left foot pad. I am pretty large, 6'6" 235lbs, but still under the published weight limit of the stepper (250lbs). It is not safe to use any longer. Too bad, because it is nice option during the snowy and rainy springs in Michigan.
customer_reviews.author: Asa Davis

customer_reviews.title: I like this stepper a lot
customer_reviews.text: I read the review before I buy this stepper. One of the review says "The instructions say to limit workouts to 10-15 mins". I did not pay too much attention to it cuz this stepper has 4.3 out of 5 stars. I like this stepper a lot. I really like it. BUT now I have a big concern. Look at the photo I attached with this review, those two tubes are burning hot after 30 minutes workout~!!!l Like curling iron~! But Since so many people are still using this stepper, the concern I have may not be a big issue. I am just not comfortable using it.
customer_reviews.author: JdaClutch

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm nowhere near the weight limit on this thing. I'm only 158 pounds and I've used this machine everyday for an hour for the past two months and during my workout today it cracked!! What a waste of money!! I'm not happy at all!!!!! In the middle of my workout!!! Damn!
customer_reviews.author: SweetPotato

customer_reviews.title: Omg! I’m excited about this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Just got it today and it was easy to put together and now I’m on my weight loss journey!
customer_reviews.author: Casandria Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd brand of stair stepper I've tried and by far the best I've used! Very solid & sturdy and gives you a great workout. I use while binge watching my shows doing 15 minute sets. The resistance cords have solid metal clips and add plenty of difficulty. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: GiGi

customer_reviews.title: Small Deception!
customer_reviews.text: Very, very limited movement that you can do even without this machine. I own Exerpeutic Elliptical which is worth every penny even though I do couple of second coming and going all day long. It gives me great results on the knee. Great workout on the heart and feels light all day long. But with this machine, I don't see or feel any good impact. So I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: wonderwoman

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this Sidestepper every day since it arrived a few days ago. I am 6 feet 240 pound male in recovery from chronic illnesses and have spent much of the last two years in bed. This device took less than a minute to assemble and although I am very deconditioned, this unit feels incredibly stable and comfortable to use and the range of settings I’m sure will provide continuous value as I regain strength. This was an excellent purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: SoCalGeo

customer_reviews.title: Quite good for a compact elliptical
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small office and wanted a small exercise machine while I take a break from work. This machine was small and can be easily stored under my desk. It a great way to get moving instead of sitting idle all day. The only issue I have with it is that even on the most loose setting on the knob the elliptical was quite hard to step down and makes it really slow so you can’t really do quick and fast pace steps on it.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty little piece of equipment, it doesn’t feel cheap or scary to be on, well made, solid and sturdy. Works great for me at 130 lbs and for my large husband at 240. It was too tight with the resistance at the beginning but my husband put WD-40 on the hydraulics and it’s working great now- I can get it going for a brisk walk. Still takes a lot of muscle! Feels like hiking up a hill. After 5-10 minutes the steps loosen more so you can really get moving.
customer_reviews.author: Zanlue

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stepper for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd stepper of this style I've ever owned, and this is far superior to the one I purchased 4 years ago because of the 'twist' action. The 'twist' more closely mimics how one would walk up-down stairs in real life, which is why I feel I get a much better workout, short of real stairs or a much-more expensive stair master machine. This also works great in areas with low headroom; it adds about a foot to your height, so if you're 6' you can use this with ceilings at least 7' in height. The resistance bands are a nice addition and good for arm/shoulder workouts.
customer_reviews.author: s-kaf

customer_reviews.title: My second one
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the second time. After a number of years of use, one of the cylinders broke. I didn't know where to look for a new one, so, I purchased a second time. Perfect for thigh muscles. I like it when it's too hot to go outside and walk. Would purchase a third time.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Colden

customer_reviews.title: Better than the gym!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this! I am use to working out several times a week at a gym, however, the play n learn center is closed for my son. So I thought I'd try this inexpensive little thing & I couldn't be happier. It was ready to use in less than 5 minutes. I bought this July 13th & use it several times a week. It gives an entire body workout, If you use the resistance arm bands. You can change the level of intensity as you grow stronger. And the battery meter is a plus as well.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Bad Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Product broke within a few months of receiving it. Contacted customer support for the product maker to get a warranty part or repair and I never received a reply back after the initial email requesting information. Followed up with them a few weeks later after submitting information and still never received a reply. I do not recommend this product. The warranty is meaningless and if you have any issues with the product you’ll be stuck with a pile of junk.
customer_reviews.author: James Alonso

customer_reviews.title: Good Workout in a Tiny Space
customer_reviews.text: This little machine gives me a great workout, especially the arms. It's easy to assemble. It is a little stiff right out of the box but it loosens up with use. If you need to make adjustments to the resistance be careful because the adjustment knob is the same one that holds it together and I would also recommend wiping it down after each use to avoid the accumulation of dust. I really like the product for toning and light exercise. It's good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Storm  Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for office!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little stepper! Working remotely and being on a computer for long hours I've noticed my legs ache a lot. I bought this hoping I'd be able to use it throughout the day to strengthen legs, improve circulation, and prevent that aching. It did the trick! It fits perfectly in my office and I use it 3-4 times a day to get my heart going and fight the effects of my sedentary job. The movements are smooth and quiet. Love this!!! Such a great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: C. MCCLELLAN

customer_reviews.title: Quarantine life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Good stepper because I’m staying in with no exercise! The digital thing doesn’t work ( old battery maybe or not hooked up right?) but this is great in front of tv or to music. It’s cheap but sturdy. Great for stay at home times. Stay safe stay in!
customer_reviews.author: valerie

customer_reviews.title: Mini Stair master
customer_reviews.text: This feels like you are climbing up hill! I can only do about 30-40 minutes a day, I wake up the next day and my Butt and legs are on fire. Space saving and works great. NOTE: this is not to replace a treadmill or elliptical this is going to be more like a stair master.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Great way to get in some cardio at your standing desk!
customer_reviews.text: So I have a stand-up desk, and while I stand 98% of the day, I was looking for something to give me some more movement while standing. (I also will use resistance bands on my legs, but the stepper adds that cardio element). This has been amazing! Now I work in a lot of excel, and writing formulas challenging, but while data refreshing, this is awesome. I work to get 5 min each 30 minutes. As you can see, I can get my heart rate up! So easy to set-up! I looked at pricier models but decided to give this one a shot! Only on Day 2 of use, but love!
customer_reviews.author: cyndi christenson

customer_reviews.title: Great machine!
customer_reviews.text: It's easy to use and easy to adjust. I don't have any problems with noise, though I did have one other issue not related to product performance. Amazon was quick to respond and fix it as usual, which is the only reason I mentioned it at all. I weight about 180 and really feel it in my legs, thighs, glutes, and even lower back. That's good, because I've had disc surgery at L5-S1, so I'm trying to strengthen the muscles around it. I recommended it several of my friends!
customer_reviews.author: Tegan M

customer_reviews.title: Impressive customer support.
customer_reviews.text: The machine itself is quite excellent. I don't know why some people had trouble assembling it thinking that the cable does not fit. All you have to do is loosen the supplied bolt and lower one of the legs and done the cable pops onto the wheel. Anyway, I got this in March and just a few days ago one of the cylinders broke at the head. I contacted customer support and they immediately honored the warranty and sent me a replacement cylinder free of charge. I got it in 2 days. There was no arguing or anything. They were supremely professional and remarkably prompt. I have to admire that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: TIP: If you can't get the cable on, try putting the other pedal up instead.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and it set up fairly easily. I worked out for 30 minutes and was sweating profusely! I think it's great that I can workout in front of the TV in this hot weather. It didn't get too hot either. Only one suggestion, for some reason, when I went to attach the cable, it was impossible until I lifted the other pedal instead. I had lifted the right pedal and tried to insert the cable. When I put the right pedal down and lifted the left, it was then possible to attach the cable. Just FYI, in case anyone else has trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Bekanell

customer_reviews.title: Multitasking at its best
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I got tired of making excuses to avoid working out. I have a veridesk at work and made a point of getting 2500 steps during my work day. Funny thing; the counter only registers one step for every two as if my left foot doesn’t deserve to be counted...lol. So, I’m actually doing 5,000 steps per day. It’s a good workout and if you incorporate the resistance bands, you’ll easily break a sweat. I wait until the end of the day to include them for that exact reason. I’ve gotten a few funny looks at first when people walk by my office but now everyone is buying one!
customer_reviews.author: Furby

customer_reviews.title: Super Squeaky!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware! I bought this because it looked like a great price with great reviews, but it was mostly just smoke & mirrors. The product worked great for about 30 minutes, then started squeaking with every step. I tried WD-40 as well as silicone lubricant, neither fixed the issue. I later realized that the same product has many listings on Amazon, which I assume is the vendor's way of hiding truthful negative reviews. I finally spent triple the amount on another product that was clearly US-made, which has clearly superior build quality and no noise issues.
customer_reviews.author: B.E.W.

customer_reviews.title: Good for pinch hitting
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be an easy, cheap solution for quick home exercise while continuing to save up for a rowing machine. Has worked fine for a few months now, a little "squeaking" but nothing that I'm concerned about. I have Benny Goodman playing so loud when I use it hardly matters anyway. I'm down about 7-8 lbs, which would no doubt be more if I better adhered to my diet.
customer_reviews.author: Atticus

customer_reviews.title: Love this stepper!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this stair stepper for about 4 days. I wanted something small and quiet I could use while watching TV. This thing is perfect! Small, quiet and a good workout! I could only do about 50-100 steps at a time at first, now I'm up to 500 steps at a time (I take a few minutes break in between sets). It gets my heart rate up and it feels good, but I control how hard it is with the step height. I don't like exercising, but so far this is making it much easier,. Very nice machine!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Goshe

customer_reviews.title: Resistance cable broke in four months
customer_reviews.text: At first I liked this product. Got up my heart rate enough to get a decent cardio workout. I wouldn't expect a great leg workout though. I used about 3 times a week for four months and the machine cable snapped while I was on it. I would not recommend. I see now why it was so affordable. Update: Amazon would not replace or refund so I contacted Sunny because the product was still under warranty. They sent me a new cable with no tools or instructions on how to replace it. I still have not been able to change it. Very poor customer service in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: C Milli

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and easy to use. Easy storage and is not too heavy to pick up and move. So glad I bought this product. Just 20 minutes a day and I already see the results. Perfect for those days where you just don't feel like going to the gym and works just as good as all that expensive in home machines and equipment
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Franko

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just got this, but so far 5 stars!! (I was a certified personal trainer for 2 years) My ONLY complaint is I wish there were foot straps.... But great otherwise! *UPDATE* This isn't a strong enough resistance for me. So many people complained about it being too hard that I thought it would be good. I quit being a personal trainer when I got pregnant due to complications and haven't worked out since-4 years now. This needs to be 2-4 times stronger for me to feel like it's a proper workout.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, quality workout
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 different exercisers, but I wanted something to use in my office since I'm working at home. I put the stepper by a window and get up every hour to do at least 5 minutes of stepping with a longer workout at lunch. I feel great all day. The quality of construction is very good-I ordered a unit with a higher weight capacity than I might need just in case. Assembly was simple and the arm bands make for a great upper body workout while stepping.
customer_reviews.author: Southerner

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to walk on, but good workout.
customer_reviews.text: Good workout, but no adjustment to loosen steps for easier steping. When I first started using I needed to have 2 wood walking poles for stability, because the steps required such a hard up down thrust. As I got stronger I was able to discard the walking sticks but it took over a month.
customer_reviews.author: IMHO

customer_reviews.title: Not silent but effective
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, I used mine for 30 mins a day for the first week. It’s louder than I hoped for, every time I push down it makes a loud tap noise. After about 5 mins of use the pistons starts to make noise like they need oiled. And there’s a weird clicking noise that sounds like it’s coming from the pedals but all the screws are tight so I haven’t figured that out yet. It gets the heart going good enough but I stopped using it cause it sounds like it’s gonna break and I need to get some WD4D.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Faye

customer_reviews.title: Good price for what you get
customer_reviews.text: It's an inexpensive machine and I imagine you can get a great workout while getting the heart rate up. Mine however collected dust which is my fault but the machine certainly does not grab my attention as a larger more expensive one probably would. I find that when you really try to get into it and the pedals bottom out it sends an impact shock through you as if you are jogging and just is not easy on your legs imo.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Stepper works pretty good - Careful when buying Used
customer_reviews.text: Product is pretty compact and feels heavy duty. It works perfectly with my stand up desk. I did take a star off for the inaccurate description. I purchased Used with a "Very Good" rating - supposedly with only minor imperfections. However it was missing the LCD screen and the resistance bands.
customer_reviews.author: Stan M

customer_reviews.title: Can kick your butt
customer_reviews.text: I've had this stepper for a few months now. Not using it as much as I thought I would, but has left me sweating the times I have. I use it for around 30 mins when I do pull it out. It is harsher on the knees than I expected. Don't remember is this is supposed to be low impact or not. It's great if you just want to get moving while watching tv.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Quintero

customer_reviews.title: Simple and fun
customer_reviews.text: I love this stepper. It took 5 minutes to set up - it's nearly pre-assembled. Very sturdy! Action is smooth and quiet so far (had it for a week). Note: I am light, about 130 lbs. Recovery from a hip replacement. Doc said it was OK to use this as physical therapy to strengthen glutes and thigh. I am 3 months out of surgery. CHECK WITH YOUR DOC FIRST!! But anyway, I am very happy with this. I could do it all day! Fun way to get fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Chiachiaretto

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compact machine for working leg muscles while watching TV. It reminds me of standing while pedaling a bike. Don't worry about the few people who say it's not a workout. You're not a triathlete, right? This gets your heart rate going after a few minutes and definitely strengthens the legs. It's an added bonus that it's small enough to stow it in the closet.
customer_reviews.author: sasha

customer_reviews.title: Sunny is a Black a Cloud to me!
customer_reviews.text: This item was missing the most important item!!!! The Meter!!!!!!!! Unusable Sooooo disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little thing! I was skeptical when I purchased it and wondered how you could get a workout from it but it really does get my heart rate up. I’ve only used it a few times. It’ll be good for strength if my legs/knee muscles without impact. The resistance bands are tight so they do work your arms. The “machine” is sturdy. It’s nice to do in the living room while watching tv- you can just do it whenever. 5 minutes here, 15 minutes there.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: needs better grip on the steps, but I like the product,  a bit pricey
customer_reviews.text: WHATIS THE CANCER CAUSING LABEL REGARDING THE MATERIALS THAT THIS STEPPER IS MADE OUT OF ? (THE CUSTOMER SERVICE FILL IN SPOT TO PUT MY PHONE # IS MADE DIFFICULT & CANNOT INPUT MY CONTACT #, IS THIS DONE ON PURPOSE ? Decent product & mobility, but the step ads are too smooth, definitely need to were gripping sneakers, they should make the top part of the steps a bit gripping... I like the tension bands , but the beginning hookup is like a school bag material for a strap. Might wear out after time and could pose an injury, but I like it over all
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE for your kneees
customer_reviews.text: Terrible for your knees. I wouldn’t consider my knees as “bad” in any way-I’m only 24. After using this twice I’ve noticed it causes unbearable knee pain for DAYS after only 30 minutes of use. 100% will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Stefani

customer_reviews.title: Squeaks every time you step
customer_reviews.text: Great for cardio and getting the heart rate up. The only thing I don't like is after a few days of moderate use, it starts making creaking noises. I hope that doesn't mean it's already breaking. Edit: after a few months of using this it becomes very loud and squeaky.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't sure what to expect, especially after reading some of the reviews. However was pleasantly surprised with this product. No it is not gym quality and the range of motion is different and you step all really fast, or at least I can't. But it does do the job, the twist action is great and I feel it in my legs and it gets the heart rate and sweat going. Definetly worth the money. Use it just about everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Marine Dave

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Very compact, but you can get a good workout with it. I find the hand straps to be useful -- though I don't know how long they'll maintain their current resistance: I can work my biceps, triceps, and deltoids with them. Best off, I can exercise in any room, or even by the pool, while listening to music, watching videos, live football games, whatever. Certainly worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bernardin

customer_reviews.title: It looks like you're doing very little while you're on it
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is quite deceiving. It looks like you're doing very little while you're on it, but you're actually getting a really good workout. I try to use it 40 minutes a day 3-5 times a week. According to my fitbit, using this at a steady pace will very quickly push you into the cardio or peak zone. bonus is that it takes up such little space and is fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Gives me a good preworkout cardio exercise
customer_reviews.text: Ive had it for a few months now, I use it maybe 3 times a week. I have no complaints. I put it on one setting of difficulty and haven't adjusted it since. It always starts off pretty tight, but starts to become more lose the longer I use it, which is never more than 20-30min in one session. It does get very hot after about 20/25min.
customer_reviews.author: MsBearly

customer_reviews.title: Take it easy!  Take breaks until you build up your stamina.
customer_reviews.text: I received the Sunny Health and Fitness early. I didn’t have any problems with putting it together. I immediately used it the same day. It works you out. It tones your butt, thighs and legs. Not just your lower body but it is helping my stomach as well. I have noticed a difference in my butt being that it is plumper and sitting up in just less than 2 weeks. I used it 3 times a day for 15 minute interval. Let me just say; I had to stop rest and get back on it again. You really need to take it easy because you can over exert yourself. Just try it and see for yourself. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Rod

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this and glad I got because I can do exercise while I watch TV or do games on my cell. I don't water my time except I feel lazy/feel pain in my muscle and take breaks. Lots of ways to exercise with elastic rope thingy. Can't adjust heavyness but you will easily get used to and will be amazed how much longer you can use this as you exercise.
customer_reviews.author: chocola

customer_reviews.title: IMPRESSED!
customer_reviews.text: I'm recovering from knee surgery and trying to gain strength in my legs so I thought this stepper would be a good place to start. It was packaged so nicely with easy to follow instructions. In about 8 minutes I was trying out the stepper and was surprised at how quickly I started feeling a sweat. It's quiet, easy to move, and easy to adjust, although I'm not quite sure the tension piece offers to many resistance options. However the arm bands definitely give a nice strength workout and provided balance, too. I'm so pleased with this purchase! And yes, having a can of WD-40 will come in handy to keep things smooth and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Daring Young Red

customer_reviews.title: Lost resistance in a few minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Every time after a few minutes of using, its resistance reduces significantly no matter how I try to tight the knob to increase the resistance. My legs can't really get much exercise. I often lost interest in stepping on it within a few minutes. I rarely return product so I keep it. After that I bought a DeskCycle which actually works and has helped me to lose weight (>15lbs). Occasionally I still step on the twister stepper just to get some alternation in exercise for a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: January

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I love this item as a substitute for my Normal stair climbing and cardio workouts while we are all staying home. I can get a really good cardio workout in 30 minutes with similar heart rates to my previous workouts. It is small and light so it fits well in my small space.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary DeVries

customer_reviews.title: Solid stepper, if you dont mind a little squeaking.
customer_reviews.text: Good stepper for the price - operates very smoothly. Easy assembly, and easy to move around as needed. Like many others, mine started squeaking after several months of use (~20 minutes a day, 5x a week). A little annoying. I will start trying various oils/lubricants to see if I can make it stop. Despite this, it's still hard to beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Friends dont let friends skip leg day
customer_reviews.text: Just got this unit today 4/02/2020.... really impressed..... took 1 minute to put together.... its kind of a cross between an elliptical and a stairclimber..... i did 34 minutes on my first try and my legs are limp noodles.... for rainy/snow days or gym closures cause of the Covid-19.... less than $70..... its legit
customer_reviews.author: Doug DosSantos

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts. Good customer service. Works great
customer_reviews.text: Missing parts. Received my twist stepper. I am missing the adjustment knob and meter. It would have been simple to put together. It was also the perfect size. Update: Customer service was extremely prompt at getting me the missing parts I needed. Make sure you have your proof of purchase which is on the shipping box!
customer_reviews.author: SquirrelStruck

customer_reviews.title: Great for upstairs apartment
customer_reviews.text: My wife has been asking for a stepper for a while. I finally caved and started looking around between walmart, target, and of course, Amazon. We read lots of reviews and I picked this one. I was concerned about noise, as we live in a 3rd floor apartment (I can actually hear my downstairs neighbors cough in the morning). We set it up today (super quick and easy) and we love it! So far seems incredibly quiet and within 5 minutes of using it, you feel the burn!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: If you'd like to choose this for fun and as a side ...
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't buy this again if I had the choice! It doesn't work well at all. It works totally different from regular elliptical. After buying this and working on this stepper, I had to buy a full-sized elliptical because this didn't make me sweat at all. I'm not very athletic. I'm just a petite woman. I'm 5'4 and weigh around 100lbs. I start sweating after working on my elliptical for about 15-20 minutes, but never on this little stepper. If you'd like to choose this for fun and as a side workout tool, it may be okay. But still, I don't think it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Yoon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for working out at my desk
customer_reviews.text: I use this at my standing desk and have consistently burned an additional 300-400 calories per day since installing it. It makes it super easy to get quick workouts in in 5, 10, 15 minutes chunks through the work day. While compact, this product feels well made and is very sturdy. I'm a big guy -- 6'4", 240lbs -- and this supports me with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Very Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This stepper is a blast. Needless to say, I have a body I am trying to reveal and needed variety. As punishment, I cancelled my gym membership and added this... if I cant exercise at home then why pay for a gym right? Adjustable resistance is amazing. If you have multiple users like I do, max out the resistance after your workout and dont tell them... they will sweat like it is 110 degrees lol. I would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Elated Flo Ent.

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow I have to say, this stepper has exceeded my expectations. It's very sturdy and everything works properly including the handy monitor that keeps track of time, steps, and calories. The installation was straight forward as well. The only improvement I think it needs is more adjustment to make the resistance lighter. This stepper might be too difficult for some people, even at the lightest setting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Loved it
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little mini stepper it’s my second time buying it ... I’ve been using it for almost a month and already lost 15 pounds and I started to look toned mostly my legs for the arms I usually use weights .. I usually do 2,000 steps a day now I’m up to 3,000 which is like 5,000 calories I’m really happy 😆
customer_reviews.author: Bessy menendez

customer_reviews.title: Hurts my hips
customer_reviews.text: This will have to go back. I'm experiencing serious lower back and hip pain after very short stepping. I've carefully followed the twist instructions, and while it gets my heart rate up...the pain isn't worth it. I think this can lead to long-term issues, like needing a hip replacement.
customer_reviews.author: valkaraya

customer_reviews.title: It is good but not for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I wanted something inexpensive for my room to do some sort of exercises while watching tv, so that im not doing nothing. its not too big and does work your body. However, the way it is set up that it "twists" made my feet like slide towards the inside and it was hurting my feet and ultimately I think my knees. I'm not sure if anybody else has had this problem or will but other than that it was a good machine!
customer_reviews.author: Roma jarczynska

customer_reviews.title: It's ok for what it is
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, I don't love it. I live in a small town with no gym, and I have neither the budget nor the room for better equipment. I got this to use on days the weather isn't amenable to outdoor activities. I'm 5'5" and not in the best shape. This product's movements feel natural and it does get me to my target HR. I can feel my muscles working. It's not comparable to a $400 piece of equipment but for now, it is fine. I like having the resistance bands as an option to involve my upper body as well.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Clark

customer_reviews.title: This twister stepper is great!...
customer_reviews.text: This twister is great! I can really feel it while exercising, it's a great workout..I work up a sweat and I can really feel it in my calves, thighs and pelvis! It's sturdy and well made, it was very easy to assemble, and it's just fun. I exercise while I watch T.V. I'm happy with this purchase, it arrived in great condition and much faster then I expected...I was NOT paid or offered a discount for my honest opinion...I paid full price for this twist stepper and I am honestly pleased with it. I love it and look forward to using it everyday, it's fun:)
customer_reviews.author: Leila

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I have it sitting behind our couch in the living room and as my boys play I can be right where they are. Or when my husband watches tv I can be in the same room with him and not make any noise as I utilize this product. Makes it easier to have the capability of being in the same room as everyone else. The resistance straps are short and not as effective as Id like. Very Lightweight- my 2 year old is able to push across the room
customer_reviews.author: Matthew deane

customer_reviews.title: Compact machine that packs a big punch!!
customer_reviews.text: It may be compact but it really works you out!! The twisting motion makes it more comfortable to use than standard steppers and the large pedals make it easy to find the right foot placement for balance. When it first arrived I thought 15min on this little thing was gonna be nothing, I was WRONG! After 15 minutes I felt I had gotten not only a great leg workout but I could feel it in my core as well!! It's very light and compact so it's perfect for someone who doesn't have room for a large machine and easy to bring out for a quick workout. I also love that it's display shows you step count, time, and calories burned.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki June

customer_reviews.title: Good product if you're already fit and ripped.
customer_reviews.text: Like the customer service at Sunny, great people, replaced the meter that I probably lost during unpacking in two days top. Dislike how heavy this product is, great stepper though, makes you sweat, but pretty awkward pedal alignment, feet are inverted inward and feels uncomfortable, stiff on the knees.
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and smooth
customer_reviews.text: This is very sturdy. I weigh over 200lbs (not for long!) and it's very smooth. I sprayed WD40 on it initially just to make sure it stays working smoothly, for what that's worth. I worried that I might not be comfortable on something like this without a frame to hold on to at times, but I haven't missed the frame at all. Great product, especially for the price and size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Who would have know it would be AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I have one for my home office and now I want to buy one to keep under my desk at work. I love it. I get on conference calls or training that I need to watch but not talk and I get on this stair stepper. It is so quick to toss in exercise to your daily routine with this.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Great, just need WD40 after some use
customer_reviews.text: I love this stepper!! It is compact and very easy to use. The only downside is that after 10k steps it started making unbearable squeaking noise. All it needed was some WD40 oil and it was working just like new. This machine is a great way to get some cardio in while staying in doors. You can change you foot positioning to target calves, quads, and/or glutes.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: Twist mean foot turned outward as you step
customer_reviews.text: Received yesterday and have tried this stepper couple of times today to start getting use it. It really does raise your heart rate if you are not use to exercise. Not sure if I like the twist part, not a natural position for my foot and I feel the strain in one of my bad knees. Using this to give me 5 minutes shots of exercise during my work day now that I am working from home.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Quarantined Steps
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to put together and provides a surprisingly good workout. It’s a bit heavy so not great to be moving it in and out of a closet a lot, but it’s definitely heavy enough to stay in place and feel really sturdy and stable while on it. It’s also very quiet which is important to me. I use it while watching tv and it isn’t distracting to me or others. Great product if you’re looking to get some easy activity in during these quarantined months.
customer_reviews.author: JLack

customer_reviews.title: 2015 Purchase Still Going
customer_reviews.text: I like this heavy-duty machine (or at least the machine they were selling in 2015). It takes up very little space, it works well, and it's great for cardio and making your quads burn. Pretty much everything I'd hoped it would be. It's not flimsy, it's actually quite heavy, and I'd be surprised if it broke in another 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Grateful Reader

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. This one does not have any use instruction, so you need to make up your workout on your own. Day 1, the peddles were bit heavy to push down, but after I got used to using this machine, they became just right as long as I stand over the edge when I do reg. stepping exercise. I think because my weight is not heavy enough. I just started to add "Speed Skating" like exercise with it, and I'm liking it. When I sit on a chair and push the peddles down, that gives me good workout, too. I enjoy using it, and make up something as I use it.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: As good as my elliptical
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after I tried my friend's "Sunny Health & Fitness Mini Stepper with Resistance Bands". I liked hers very much so I decided to order this one that twists also. I didn't notice at the time I ordered this one that it didn't say "mini" like hers. I like this one much better. The foot peddles are a little bigger and I like the feel much better. I have an elliptical and I feel like this little stepper does as much as that huge thing. I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: plum32

customer_reviews.title: Step, step, step!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really simple, small and portable form of exercise equipment. I've been using it daily for 30+ minutes for a few weeks and have enjoyed it so far. Pros: Easy to setup. Good workout due to stepping and resistance bands. Portable & Affordable Cons: Doesn't feel too durable overall, resistance bands could be better quality. Makes creaking sounds after awhile, need to use WD-40 on it. I would recommend this if you don't want to spend much, or you have limited space and need something portable. This seems to work pretty well for both of those markets, unless it ends up not being durable, but only time will tell! I'll update if anything bad happens.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Patton

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely disgraceful
customer_reviews.text: Delivery of this product was delayed for over a week. When it did arrive it had clearly been sent to another customer who had returned the package, evidently because there was a part missing without which the equipment is useless. The device had been unpacked, half built and then thrown back in the box. Upon being returned it had then evidently been relabelled and dispatched straight to me. Absolutely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Would Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great exercise machine. It’s made of good heavy and quality material. Not a cheap product at all. It’s a heavy quality product but small enough that it can be moved easily. I would highly recommend for someone who just wants something to use for exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Truly Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. REALLY provides a hearty resistance workout. Unlike other stair steppers that go up and down this actually emulates walking up stairs. We ordered the "plus" one .. there is no place in the description that indicates this handles more weight then the 220 pound weight listed, but we saw a video where the guy weighed 300 pounds and had no problems. We have a family member who weighs 250 pounds and it appears to be holding up without fail.. so I'd recommend this at this juncture.
customer_reviews.author: anosh

customer_reviews.title: Better Than I Anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Surprised how solid and effective this unit is. Seems to be made well. Heavier than I thought it would be for a small reasonably priced unit, which is good. Stable. Smooth motion. Adjustable resistance that can be used to vary pace and intensity. I'm very pleased with this purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: CarMan

customer_reviews.title: Squeaks!!!
customer_reviews.text: It started squeaking the first week I got it. I tried everything -- several kinds of lubricant, loosening and tightening the tension knob, standing on different parts of the peddle, stepping using different body positions. Nothing worked. The squeak was so annoying that I could only "take it" for about two minutes. It's been sitting in the corner gathering dust for the past nine months. If it didn't squeak, it would be awesome and if I knew FOR SURE that it wouldn't start squeaking again, I would even buy another one, but who can make that kind of guarantee?
customer_reviews.author: TH123

customer_reviews.title: VERY disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Was virtually unusable out of the box - pressure / resistance was incredibly high and we were unable to reduce it enough to make the stepper run smoothly. After about a month, all of the tension went out of it and we couldn't get any back. Now it just holds a pile of clothing in the corner of my room. What a friggin bummer.
customer_reviews.author: kitten

customer_reviews.title: Solid Machine
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this purchase. I have had back issues for years which stopped my exercise. This machine is easing me back so I can get strong again. Love how portable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey A Doby

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: The stepper works well, can be a little noisy with the hydraulic sounds but not very noticeable unless you want to work out in total silence. The hydraulics will get hot from use. This is a very sturdy little stepper and I can see it working for years. It's very low impact and leaves your thighs burning afterwards. I hardly ever used the armbands but they can really add to your workout. It's a shallower step than going up real stairs but you will still feel out of breath.
customer_reviews.author: Isengardlilly

customer_reviews.title: Great machine- great workout
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure this could be as good as a lot of the reviews said- and to be fair I've just started with it. But WOW , it IS a workout, and it's really easy to "step" and read my kindle or watch TV at the same time. I would rather be able to walk outside, but I live on a narrow county road people drive like crazies... and til I finish work , now it's starting to get dark. So THIS is the perfect alternative. I'll use it for a few weeks and update this, but so far, I would HIGHLY recommend this as a home workout machine .
customer_reviews.author: Robbielou

customer_reviews.title: Well built, quality piece of equipment for stealth workouts!
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of those people who don't go out of their way to write a review unless something is really special. I received this stepper 4 days ago, and am already in love with it! I work at home at a computer all day, and was looking for something to help me get some activity while on conference calls. This is sturdily built, fits nicely beside my desk, and is quiet. I log my steps with the UP tracker, and that works perfectly with this machine. I can get quality steps in while working, and no one even knows! I've purchased a lot of workout equipment over the years, and this one stands out... at least so far!
customer_reviews.author: ArwenOrion

customer_reviews.title: Get to steppin!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine. All the reviews say it doesn't give a "deep" step, and that is true but, if you stand correctly or bend or even stand a little higher you can get that. I am 6 foot and I get that deep step well. This is great for your butt AND legs as well as your sides. As far as the elastic straps are concerned, I can take or leave them. You can buy resistance bands or use free weights like I do. I have yet to experience any squeaking noise as posted in other articles. Great price, great product and I love the fact that I can take it another room if needed or anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Dave O

customer_reviews.title: hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help keep me moving in a limited amount of space. It was difficult to put together and really hard to use. I have tried loosening it all the way but I still am able to stand on one leg and have the step slowly go down and it's not like I weight 20lbs or anything
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping, excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a lot of steppers in the past and they haven't worked out to well for me. I love this one! I started the #giveit100 challenge and I used this mini stepper for at least a half hour for 100 days and i've lost 15 pounds. I find the machine to be the perfect size and once im done I just store it right under my bed. I also find the petal size to be pretty large. The only down side I have with the machine is it is a bit loud. Other than that, I am very happy with my purchase and I would buy another one from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Aerobic Exercise for Us with lung problems
customer_reviews.text: After using this for the last few months, I am changing this to 5 stars. I use it 15 minutes every other day and it has helped my breathing capacity a lot. I have mild emphysema and have to work at it to not lose anything. My regret is I didn't buy the one with a handle as I cannot balance on this and I have to do it in a doorway to have something to hold on. It started squeaking but then quit that. It seems to be holding up very well for a relatively inexpensive piece of equipment. It is probably not for really fit people as the pistons do get hot after 15 minutes of steady use.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Step on it!
customer_reviews.text: This is good I have it next to my desk since I work from home and when I’m on break or lunch I step on it. It will give you a little hard work to do and get your steps for the day. Is kind of heavy but not that bad. the only thing that I didn’t like is that it wasn’t in a concealed package so everyone could see what I bought.
customer_reviews.author: JVBM

customer_reviews.title: Daily workouts
customer_reviews.text: I just received it today and excitedly placed it in a room to use. After 10 minutes I felt it working my thighs. I have titanium in my left hip so any jump rope or running workouts were not working for cardio. I think this machine will be perfect for daily use to burn off excess weight and tone my thighs. I do not think it will help my butt as far as toning, but it should help other problem areas. Only reason I gave it 4 stars is because at the lowest resistance it was still hard to move. I know the max weight is 250 lbs. But maybe there is a minimum. I am just under 130 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Good

customer_reviews.title: Great for Quick Workout
customer_reviews.text: Great for a quick workout when I feel lazy at home. I don't have a lot of space, so this is perfect and can store easily in my closet. I love the resistance bands it comes with for an added level of difficulty. I use it when watching TV mainly. It has a timer on it, but these things always seem to fall off on these kinds of products. I don't keep track of how long I use them anyway, so doesn't matter. It feels sturdy and is a solid piece of equipment. The resistance can be adjusted by simply turning the knob on the end.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Hay

customer_reviews.title: This thing is freaking awesome! I usually feel lazy when I sit and ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is freaking awesome! I usually feel lazy when I sit and watch a movie at home, at least now I can get some steps in :) You don't burn as many calories as you would on an elliptical at the gym, but it takes up barely any space.
customer_reviews.author: Shara L. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. I had just moved to a smaller apartment that couldn't fit my bulky elliptical, and with a tight budget, I sprung for this. It's great for what it is, I use it to help stay toned and it fits discretely under my desk when not in use. It's great, but not perfect: the stride length is tiny, it can be squeaky, and I'd mostly love to be able to increase the resistance dramatically. For most people who aren't super athletic, this is more than adequate. I'd definitely recommend, especially before considering investing in a giant, expensive piece that collects dust.
customer_reviews.author: ACromy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent, happy.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set up, just lift one pedal and hook the wire and begin...i didn't bother to set up the bungie cords, it wasn't a feature I wanted. Max weight states 250. And the instructions do state to not use more than 15 minutes, but it doesn't really say why. Takes a minute to get used to the motion since the pedals go in a slightly sideways motion (almost like roller skating, but not as much of a slide if that makes sense), but once you get your balance and the feel of it I find it is sort of fun. Works for what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Ceranic

customer_reviews.title: Good, discreet little device
customer_reviews.text: Moved from mountainous Alaska to flat Louisiana and wanted to keep my uphill hiking conditioning so I got this. Worked really well and also incorporates a small twist like you're walking through sand. Work quite nicely. I put it in front of my standing desk at home and do my work, watch movies, play video games all while getting a little workout in. I wouldn't say it's a 100% replacement for hiking mountains or even doing actual stairs, but when there isn't any actual elevation gains to be had, this at least keeps you in shape.
customer_reviews.author: Will Spaeth

customer_reviews.title: Kind of like skating.
customer_reviews.text: Computer doesn't work. I don't care. I'm not counting anyway. It's actually quiet! I watch movies while using this. It more closely resembles the motion of ice skating than climbing stairs but that's fine. I used to skate almost every day till I moved to sunny California where I got fat from sitting inside hiding from the unrelenting endless summer. Anyway, it seems to work pretty good. It's fairly well built for the price. I don't really expect a top-end chunk of gym equipment but I think it will hold up for at least a few months to get my legs accustomed to moving again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: When I got this the company failed to send me the little device but they were cool about sending me one once I emailed them. This is an easy machine to use and it's quiet. It's easy to use the tension knob too. It does get hot like other people have said. Just try not to touch it! It is kind of heavy but its not bad.
customer_reviews.author: I buy a lot of crap.

product_meta.title: Sunny Health & Fitness Twist Stepper - NO. 045
feature_bullets: TWIST ACTION: Twist action helps you tone thighs and buttocks, while achieving a challenging cardiovascular workout; work deep muscles in hard-to-reach places without putting stress on joints.
DURABILITY: Heavy-duty steel construction provides years of reliable use; oversized, slip-resistant foot plates keep you firmly planted during workout.
DIGITAL MONITOR: LCD display shows total count, time, calories burned, and rep count. adjustable height helps work your deep muscles without putting extreme pressure on bones and joints.
RESISTANCE BANDS: Removable exercise bands work arms, chest, back, and shoulders for total body workout.
ADJUSTABLE HEIGHT: Use the height adjustment lever to adjust the step height before your workout on your compact stepper.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
